title: TAG Heuer announces new official Premier League Young Player of the Season award
text:
Premier League players aged 23 and under will have the opportunity to win a new award at the end of the season with TAG Heuer has launching a new official Young Player of the Season award.

The Premier League Player of the Season award has been in existence since 1995 along with the PFA Players' Player of the Year gong.

Until now there was only a PFA prize for young players but that will all change at this year's Premier League end-of-season ceremony.

TAG Heuer have announced a new Premier League Young Player of the Year award

The new accolade will sit alongside the already established Player of the Season, Goal of the Season and Manager of the Season awards.

The shortlist will be released in April and will be determined using official match data to select eligible players with outstanding performance and statistics across the 2019-20 season.

The shortlist will then be voted on by the general public and the Premier League Awards Panel, with the eventual winner being announced in May 2020.

Raheem Sterling was crowned the PFA Young Player of the Year last season.

Raheem Sterling was crowned the winner of the PFA Young Player of the Year last season

TAG Heuer, the Official Timekeeper for the Premier League, have announced a new Premier League award for the 2019/2020 season; The TAG Heuer Young Player of the Season Award.
